Node.definition: = range of mountains; ◄ north of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) ► known for the cedar (אֶרֶז) and other trees growing there

= causative action by which humans or deities allow others entrance, passage, or access (in)to a building, construction, or area ◄ by withdrawing a gate, door, window, lid, covering, or other boundary; ≈ sometimes associated with freedom, sometimes with being exposed, vulnerable
= something that provides or prevents access ◄ as if it were a door
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

= evergreen tree growing up to 40 m tall, with a trunk up to 2.5 m in diameter; as it grows older its branches spread out more and more horizontally; grows in elevated places; ◄ Cedrus libani; ► highly appreciated building material; also used in cleaning ritual; ≈ associated with beauty, quality, pride, and strength
= action by which humans utter a high pitched cry to give expression to an emotion, which is usually grief or distress, but can also be triumph and glee

exact meaning unsure: = one of the evergreen trees commonly found in the Lebanon, with round leaves rather than flat; its fruit is a a mostly inedible seed bearing, fleshy cone; ≈ regarded as one of the glorious trees of the Lebanon
= process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

= evergreen tree growing up to 40 m tall, with a trunk up to 2.5 m in diameter; as it grows older its branches spread out more and more horizontally; grows in elevated places; ◄ Cedrus libani; ► highly appreciated building material; also used in cleaning ritual; ≈ associated with beauty, quality, pride, and strength
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
= pertaining to inspiring awe and respect ◄ because of one's beauty, size, strength, or status

Node.gloss: to ravage|to devastate|to lay waster|to plunder
Node.definition: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process
= action by which humans utter a high pitched cry to give expression to an emotion, which is usually grief or distress, but can also be triumph and glee

= a large size tree found either alone or in clumps or forests; ◄ one of the varieties of |iQuercus|i*; ► functioned as landmarks, grave marks or gathering places; since its groves were considered sacred by Canaanites, ritual practices under them was always a temptation to Israelites, denounced in the texts as idolatry; ≈ their characteristics made them suitable symbols of a variety of attributes or attitudes
= region; ◄ north east of the River Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) ► at one time ruled by king Og (עֹוג) later assigned to half of the tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)

Node.gloss: to go down|to come down|to fall down|to sink down|to descend
Node.definition: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place
= a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals
= read הַבָּצוּר (בצר) with MT K
= action by which humans utter a high pitched cry to give expression to their grief and distress

Node.gloss: to ravage|to devastate|to lay waster|to plunder
Node.definition: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process
= state of being regarded with honor and respect
= action by which animals, humans, or deities produce a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion
= a young male lion (אֲרִי) ≈ regarded as fierce and dangerous

Node.gloss: to ravage|to devastate|to lay waster|to plunder
Node.definition: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process
= dense growth of shrubbery or small trees, habitat of animals
= river; ◄ flowing from Mount Hermon (חֶרְמֹון) in a southerly direction through the Sea of Galilee (כִּנֶּרֶת) into the Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= causative action by which humans lead domestic animals to places where they can feed on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd
= the killing of domestic animals for food, sometimes extended to refer to the killing of people in a cruel and violent way
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to acquire|to obtain|to purchase|to buy|to reclaim
Node.definition: = action by which humans acquire an animate or inanimate object ◄ by means of a financial transaction or in another way
= causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way

Node.gloss: to bear one's guilt|to be punished
Node.definition: = to bear the consequences for an unlawful deed for which one is held responsible
= causative action by which humans hand over objects or privileges in their possession in exchange for goods or money

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to be concerned for|to have pity on|to show mercy|to spare
Node.definition: = process by which humans or deities experience an emotion of affection for a particular object or state of event; ► resulting in unwillingness to see that object come to harm or that event to be obstructed

Node.gloss: to be concerned for|to have pity on|to show mercy|to spare
Node.definition: = process by which humans or deities experience an emotion of affection for a particular object or state of event; ► resulting in unwillingness to see that object come to harm or that event to be obstructed
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
literally: to cause (someone) to find themselves in the hand (of someone else); hence: = causative process by which humans cuase other humans to be in the power of a thrid party

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= causative action by which an army gains the upper hand over an opposing army with a total victory

= state in which a countable entity is the first in a range

particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= causative action by which humans transfer the possession of an object to someone else
= a fixed regular payment for work, either with money or in kind; ≈ by extension: all that happens in return for one's actions

= causative action by which humans desist from performing an event that has not yet started

= a relationship linking two or more individuals or groups

= human made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident; this could also refer to the wound or disease itself
